thread.title: The ultimate Disney holiday

author: The Telegraph
title: The ultimate Disney holiday
text: If you have explored six incredible parks packed full of fun at Walt Disney World in Florida, and you do not want the magic to end, the good news is it does not have to. Continue the fun on board a Disney Cruise around the Bahamas or Caribbean for the ultimate Disney holiday. Walt Disney World’s six parks offer a truly amazing range of activities where you can create magical memories with your family and have something suitable for every member. And with more than 100 places to dine, there is something for every palate at every meal. Magic Kingdom Park has classic attractions for all the family, wonderful fireworks, musical parades and beloved Disney characters across six lands (Adventureland, Frontierland, Liberty Square, Fantasyland, Tomorrowland and Main Street, USA). Thrill seekers can enjoy the high-octane Rock ‘N’ Roller Coaster At the end of Main Street sits the magical Cinderella Castle, and thrill-seekers will love the big rides, ranging from Space Mountain to the Haunted Mansion, while the Dumbo the Elephant ride and the recent addition to Fantasyland, the Seven Dwarfs Mine Train, feature as favourite attractions. Epcot has two distinct realms: Future World, featuring technological innovations; and World Showcase, celebrating the culture and cuisine of 11 countries through pavilions, attractions, food and events. Must-dos at Epcot include Test Track, where you can design your own concept car, then take it for a high-octane spin to see how it performs in an amazing simulation, and Soarin’, the awe-inspiring experience that makes you feel like you are hang-gliding over the beautiful landscapes of California. Disney’s Hollywood Studios celebrates the glitz and glamour of the film world, with attractions based on blockbuster movies and TV shows in eight areas: Hollywood Boulevard, Echo Lake, Sunset Boulevard, Streets of America, Commissary Lane, Pixar Place, Mickey Avenue and Animation Courtyard. You will love Toy Story Midway Mania, where you can join Andy’s friends, Woody, Hamm, Buzz Lightyear and Rex for fun games and rides. Younger children will be entranced by Disney Junior Live, where they can sing and dance with their favourite characters Doc McStuffins, Sofia the First, and Jake and his band of Never Land Pirates. Light years ahead: Toy Story Midway Mania is always a hit with children Thrill-seeking families can enjoy the high-octane 100km/h Rock ‘N’ Roller Coaster starring Aerosmith, and the Twilight Zone Tower of Terror – a lift that climbs high before crashing back down to ground level. And there is Disney’s Animal Kingdom Park, one of the largest animal theme parks in the world. Home to 1,700-plus incredible animals in six lands: Oasis, Discovery Island, Africa, Rafiki’s Planet Watch, Asia and DinoLand, USA. Do not miss Expedition Everest – Legend of the Forbidden Mountain, a rollercoaster that whisks you through the Himalayas; travel back in time to a prehistoric world on the Dinosaur ride; get ready for a soaking on the Kali River Rapids; and take an open-air ride through the savannah to spot real lions and elephants on the Kilimanjaro Safaris. More fun awaits at two brilliant water parks, Disney’s Typhoon Lagoon and Disney’s Blizzard Beach, packed with thrill rides and even a surf pool. Board a two-person raft to take on Typhoon Lagoon’s Crush ‘n’ Gusher, sending you flying down a “fruit chute” around hairpin bends as you are blasted with water jets. But there is also plenty of relaxation, with lazy rivers, white sandy beaches, special play areas for younger children and even a surf pool. Disney Cruise deck parties are magical music-and-dance extravaganzas There is also Downtown Disney, full of world-class restaurants, entertainment and shops, and Disney’s BoardWalk, a long promenade of restaurants, shops and nightlife. Now get ready for more Disney-style fun as you set sail on a Disney Cruise, for guests of all ages to enjoy together as a family or separately in their own dedicated areas. The ships all feature a vast range of activities and amenities. Dining is exceptional on board, featuring freshly prepared dishes inspired by the cuisine of the world. You can choose between the three main distinctly themed restaurants each evening and your servers will switch with you, ensuring a friendly face at each dinner. Self-service options and adults-only dining plus 24-hour room service complete the array of eateries you will find on board. You will be royally entertained during your whole cruise. State-of-the art theatres host live West End-calibre shows and first-run movies. There are a number of opportunities for children to meet and greet Disney characters. So bad they're good: See the Disney baddies at Villains Night Disney Cruise Line deck parties are magical music-and-dance extravaganzas not to be missed, from the Sail-Away Celebration to Pirate Night. For youngsters, there are also fun-filled kids clubs, each with their own amazing activity area, carefully tailored for each age group, from youngsters through to tweens and teenagers. There is even an on-board water coaster, Aquaduck, with a four-deck drop and a section suspended over the side of the ship that the children will want to ride again and again. Adults have their own spaces as well - themed bars, nightclubs and lounges, and an elegant spa. There are also themed freshwater pools for kids, families and adults on all ships. And reserved exclusively for guests on Disney Cruise Line Bahamian and Caribbean cruise holidays, there is Castaway Cay, Disney’s sun-soaked private island, offering many leisure activities such as water sports, swimming and sunbathing. Why not relax with a luxurious treatment in an open-air cabana, complete with sea view, in a secluded area of the Cay? Ample amenities include open-air BBQs, shops and port adventures from glass-bottom boat tours, to parasailing and fishing. What more could you want? • Find out more about Disney Cruises, Disney holidays and Walt Disney World
